photo.title: Mark Twain House

photo.description: The writer and his family lived in this Victorian Gothic-style home from 1874-1891. An elderly Harriet Beecher Stowe was one of his neighbors. Hartford, Conn.
photo.tags: marktwain marktwainhouse marktwainhouseandmuseum hartfordct
photo.title: The Mark Twain House and Museum

photo.description: Mark Twain House and Museum, Hartford, Conn.
photo.tags: marktwain marktwainhouse marktwainhouseandmuseum hartfordct lego legos replica
photo.title: Lego Mark Twain House ... with a Lego Mark Twain!

photo.description: The Mark Twain House and Museum was the home of Mark Twain (a.k.a. Samuel Langhorne Clemens) from 1874 to 1891 in Hartford, Connecticut, USA. Before 1874.
photo.tags: marktwain literature literatura hartford connecticut geotagged
photo.title: Mark Twain, his house in Hartford, CT

photo.title: Mark Twain House - Check to Julia Grant

photo.tags: marktwain samuelclemens house home hartford ct interior
photo.title: Mark Twain House

photo.description: A copy of a check that Twain's publishing company wrote to Ulysses S. Grant's wife, Julia. Twain published Grant's memoirs which basically saved the Grant family from bankruptcy. The amount of the check was $200,000 which was an astronomical sum of money in 1885.
photo.tags: juliagrant ulysses grantgrantmark twainsamuel clemens house home hartford ct interior
photo.title: $200,000 Check to Julia Grant

photo.tags: first lady laura bush mark twain neh
photo.title: First Lady visits Mark Twain House and Museum

photo.description: First Lady Laura Bush (center) visits the Mark Twain House and Museum in Hartford, Connecticut during a week-long workshop sponsored by the National Endowment for the Humanities. Also pictured are NEH chairman Bruce Cole (left) and Secretary of Education Margaret Spellings (right).
photo.tags: first lady laura bush mark twain neh spellings cole
photo.title: First Lady visits Mark Twain House and Museum
